text: Five stars for the falafel at Amena!  Similar in style to the falafel in pita at Sababa (hummus, cabbage, pickles, tomatoes, etc), but even better.  Their pita is fluffy & delicious, like soft little pillows.  Falafel are bright green, flavorful, and the perfect size.  You order at the counter and when it's ready, you come up and chose what veggies you want inside.  They also have a good homemade hot sauce on the tables, and a great selection of bakery items including a really great baklava.  Best falafel in pita I've had in Vegas.  I wish I'd tried this place sooner... the creepy Trader Joe's strip mall/dive-y location was throwing me off.  I should have trusted Misty's review because I've been missing out!  And like she said- they sell their pita bread!!
Great middle eastern deli with several vegetarian choices.  Very inexpensive and extremely friends staff.  Baklava is a must.

The bread makes the meal testier , we ordered the combination plate which it has beef shawarma, chicken shawarma and falafel but it did not have the tomatoes (where's the tomatoes and the pickled turnip) I have to say the waiters was very pleasant but she lacks experience or maybe because she was the cashier busboy waiters.

I don't understand the high star reviews.  This place is OK at best.  The beef sharwma is not what I usually I'm am used to...its basically not.. Service is OK..they forgot my water even though I was the only customer lol. One girl is polite and pretty :)

Warm, friendly, generous people, amazing food (especially Pita, dolmas, hummus, FALAFEL, eggplant dishes, oh, and balaclava - don't miss that).  and if you like french fries made from fresh potatoes, you're in heaven. One of my favorite spots to eat anywhere, and certainly in Vegas. I'd give it more stars If I could.  Get the home-made lemonade!

Our first dining experience in Vegas. Exactly what we needed - delicious and authentic food, super friendly service, welcoming environment. The grape leaves were mouth watering, the pita was fresh made, the baklava was delicious. Definitely get food from here at least once.

We were just sort of driving around when we stumbled on this place. I ordered a gyro plate, and I gotta say, it was amazing. The hummus was perfect, the salad was fresh and delicious, and the meat was tender and perfectly seasoned. Desserts looked great too, but I didn't have any. The only reason I'm giving this 4 stars is because my husband wasn't crazy about the lamb chops he ordered... He thought they were small for the price and overdone. But if you're looking for something healthy, they had a lot of great options. I would definitely go back.

The best falafel in town. It is so delicious and fluffy. The baklava is heaven, not too sweet and huge. The katayef is delicious as well.  A little oily but has outstanding flavor.  I've never had a bad meal and the staff is super friendly. The owner is usually there and greets everyone that walks in.
Tasty food, great service. This place has earned a new regular customer.

Great lunch spot, great service and hospitality. I don't like to rate restaurants based on 1 trip, 1 dish but from what I ordered, the veggie combo, I loved the hummus and pita bread but the greatest thing that I had was the falafel and baklava. Highly recommended.  My favorite bites from Amena Bakery & Deli are the falafel and the baklava.
Delicious and fresh. I have trouble deciding what to get because it all tastes good. They make their pita bread! Love this place.

We were headed to Trader Joes as we just checked in to our suite fresh off a long drive from California. We saw the place in the same plaza and quickly looked to see if hey had a Yelp review. We were pleasantly surprised to see that it had a good review and we were starved.   We both ordered combo plates. I asked for no salad, sub baba, she asked no salad, sub tabouli. The staff accommodated us easily. No extra charge. We tried their meat couscous dish per the owners recommendation...OMG, we could not stop eating. Overall friendly staff, good Mediterranean food, large portions. Definitely would come back.

This place is amazing . My first time here and I was greeted with some complimentary treats that were delicious ! Not to mention thw guro was very authentic and fantastic . The chef really knows what he's doing , and he really makes you feel at home in the restaurant . I will for sure be back .

Oh my! Oh my! I am absolutely impressed with this unassuming little deli. The combo plate is just awesome. I had the fries with the combo plate and that took the mixed flavors of the meal to a whole new level. The service is very good and prompt. The food does not arrive fast, which I thought was a good thing. Did not have a fast food ambience or a fast food taste. I travel to Las Vegas every year and this will be a stop I make every time.

WOW! I just happened to be hungry and wandered into this amazing little place!   I bought the fresh baked pita bread - yummy, the hummus - very good, and the most delicious baklava I have ever tasted in my entire life!   Go. Get. It.

This is one of the best middle eastern restaurants we have been to. The owners are so welcoming and kind, and the food is amazing. Hummus with fava beans and falafel was great, warm pita bread was excellent. Don't miss the mint lemonade. We also tried the kunefa and several cookies which were all delicious. Wish we lived closer!

This place is amazing.. We are from Salt Lake City and never miss coming here...  Everything on the menu is awesome and the service is so friendly it's shocking.. The fries are amazing and the baklava is the best I have ever had. My wife always gets the falafel.  She swears by it.  I promise if you try this place you will be a loyal repeat customer.

An island of fresh and real food from the middle east.We found it by coincidence and were very positively surprised as the place does not look very inviting from outside. The lentil soup was like the one my grandma used to do, the pita freshly baked , amazing humus and the pitas with tasty fresh ingredients. The deserts  are very authentic and the "knafe" tasted better than in Nazareth. We were with our kids and the staff is very helpful and friendly.The only downside is that the exterior atmosphere is very simple.

It was just okay.  The Filafel was pretty okay.  I do not like their yogurt sauce.  Did not even taste like yogurt.  The pita was soft & chewy at the same time, and was really good.  Their Schwarma was lame.  I don't even think they used a spick for it.  It just tasted/felt like pan fried steak.  Very little flavor.  I would not go back there again.     The workers are very nice, but the food was just too bland for me.    I want to warn that I may be a bit biased: I've been to Israel and I've had awesome Filafel & Schwarma in Europe & Turkey, and this does not even come close to the stuff you buy in the streets over there.  Oddly enough, the best Filafel I ever had was in Paris.  So don't let me ruin your experience there.  However, all I can recommend is their Filafel; and it's not a 'glowing' recommendation, but it was okay.
Best baklava recipe i have ever had! and the fresh pita bread is so soft.
Great food! Great service! Very authentic taste! Definitely one of the best Mediterranean cafe in town.

I drive by this place at twice a week and I never knew that it was here until I yelp Arabic food in the area so I decided to try it out and boy the food here was amazing. I truly recommend this place to anybody who wants to try authentic arab food
Amena had really good service and have really good plates.They have great prices I recommend it.

Very delicious and very fresh food.  Always make it a point eat here when we're here visiting from Hawaii Very friendly young lady greeting us always.   Eating at the buffets here in Vegas is fine, but sometimes you want home cooked authentic food from this place Excellent!!!!!!

I think I died and went to heaven, and heaven has a name: It's Amena.   I haven't had anything Mediterranean since I left Detroit about 2 years ago, mostly because there truly wasn't anywhere to get it in the places I've lived since then. I walked into Amena with high hopes because of good Yelp reviews and I was NOT disappointed.   I had a chicken shawarma plate, falafel, lentil soup, and a couple of pastries (baklava and another that I really have no idea what it was, but it was delicious). Everything about it was perfect and just as I had remembered it should taste, and the falafel and baklava might have been the best I've ever tasted. The lentil soup was also exceptional! The staff are very welcoming and made my experience just that much sweeter; I could not have asked for a better local deli/restaurant!   Run, don't walk, to Amena. You won't regret it.

Had a variety of different things to eat at this restaurant and I can say I was very impressed by the quality of the food. I had the chicken Shawarma plate which was real good. And had some of their freshly made cheese boureakas which was heavenly. And for desert make sure to try the cheese kunaffe and you will be totally satisfied.

Perhaps if you don't have any other Middle Eastern place to compare to, this place would be good. My husband and I dropped in here on our way out of Vegas wanting some light and quick eats. In short, the food was not very authentic and I can say that because I am of Middle Eastern decent. I know this place is rated pretty high on yelp and that is why we dropped in... Maybe we caught the cooks on a down day?  The chicken and "shawarma" meat were kinda cold. Shawarma in quotes because it wasn't shawarma; just pieces of meat sautéed on a grill with no spice at all. The chicken had I think sumac on it. Whatever spice it was, it definitely wasn't the spices used on shawarma.  The salad was not fresh at all and the hummus bland.  Overall, this place is a bit pricey for the quality and setting.  The positives: service was great, the girls that worked there were very nice and attentive. Oh and the falafel was very fresh. So get a falafel sandwich from there.

Food was quite good. Good kunaffe and kibbeh. I would definitely return. I took a star off because I thought the place could be a little cleaner. The windows were dirty and the table was super wobbly.

Amena serves dishes from owner Amer Hamed's native Israel, and indeed, there are Israelis here at any given moment, chatting away in Hebrew and eating  shawarmas. The restaurant also doubles as a bakery. Fresh pita bread, hot rolls and delicious pastries and meat pies are made on the premises daily, and that includes Saturdays.

ok.  i like this place.  i've tried many middle eastern / greek places in this town, but this is one of my favorites.  it's definitely a hole in the wall, and despite being a middle eastern restaurant, the owner seems to be israeli and the workers are mexican.  interesting, but you say halal, i say kosher.  anywho, their fallafal is really good, and so are the fries.  they also serve mexican pickled vegetables when you sit down..  why?  i don't know.  but i do recommend this place, and it's close to trader joe's.

This place is just wonderful. Absolutely the best hummus I've ever had - it's so creamy! The fresh pitas are to die for, and the owner (who I believe has rung me up every time I've been) is a really nice guy - when I was deciding what to get today, he gave me a sample of the homemade baklava, which was dissolve-in-your-mouth delicious. Amazing place, wish it was a little closer to my house!

What a quaint and warm place. I felt so welcomed, being completely unfamiliar with this type of cuisine. The lady at the counter was patient with me and I honestly felt like a stranger invited to eat in their home. Food is made with love. Others there revelled at the delicious food and declared their devotion to the place lol!! I got the knuffe and baklava and the bite into the knuffe made me pray outloud! I saw clouds part! Please eat here if you want the same emotion I've described. This is exactly how to run a fantastic restaurant!
By far the best kabob in town. The staff is absolutely fantastic. They treat you like you are at their home.

Our family just stopped in for dinner and we couldn't have had a better meal, plus awesome service! The owner was very kind and courteous. Be sure and try the lemonade! Veggie plate offers a great variety of things to try. Chicken shish kabob was delicious. And If you go on Sat they have a special dessert with cheese in it that we all loved. Or try the Kunaffe.  !
The grape leaves were terrible!! All of the rice was hard and crunchy!! The baklava was ok.. The pita and Babaganoush was really good though..

I love this place just went there for the second time and the food is so amazing and organic it tastes so good!! I'm sorry I am not a great writer to translate exactly how good it is so you have to go try it the gyro is so good and the eggplant plate was delicious !! can wait to try more of their stuff !!!!! And most important the service is excellent both times I went they explain the whole Manu to me and were so nice !! Oh and the fries are home made as well !!
Where is the 10 Stars this place it's amazing everything fresh they have the best falafel and Pita also the dessert .it's very clean and friendly the very good prices definitely come coming back

We came here based on yelp reviews, since we were visiting from out of town. The staff was patient with us, helpful and kind. The place is very clean, small and intimate and bright. The food is amazing!! Everything is fresh and tastes homemade. We're a mixture of vegans, vegetarians, and meat eaters and everyone is well fed and happy. Every time we come back to Vegas to visit we will be stopping by :)

Loved this place. A little pricey but well worth it. The owner is really nice and did his best to make sure that we had everything we needed. They ended up misunderstanding our order as we had a party of five and they thought we ordered  five combo plates when we really ordered four. But we told them we would go ahead and take the extra one which they gave us at a discount so that was nice. The hummus was probably the creamiest I ever had, maybe due to extra tahini, which means extra calories but well worth it. And the pitas were home made and like little pita pillows, so soft and tasty. I bought extra to take home. Also, the gave us as many pitas as we wanted without charge while we were eating! The portion size of the combo plate is pretty big and two people could share it. Also, one person in our party ordered mint lemonade, minus the mint, they brought it out with mint in it and she asked them for just the lemonade, they brought her a new one without mint with no complaints or questions asked. Also, they give you little olives and other pickled goods while you wait.

Absolutely delicious food !!!!!    This has to be the best middle eastern food Food you can get in Vegas.  It's very Authentic.  The Hummus tastes like my mom makes it . try the shawerma too that was incredible . they make their own bread on premises.  They truly make food with love.
Simply amazing, everything we ordered was on point . The bread is made on the spot , homemade hummus and great service

My husband and I came in today. First time eating here and it was only my 4th time having Mediterranean food... Enough to compare. I ordered the schnitzel and my husband had the shwarma (sp?). I thought the schnitzel was pretty good. It tastes like a country fried steak but not as crispy on the outside. My husband enjoyed his sandwich as well. Overall, the food was prob a 4/5.  I ordered a glass of water and it was horrible! The last put a lemon in it and it still could not mask whatever was in the glass. I had my husband tried it and he agreed. I usually drink my water with lemon in it and heck, I even drink water from the sink from time to time and that water did not taste right. I told the lady about it and she just dismissed me and said oh well maybe you're not used to the lemon. Uh, no. I'm not used to shitty water. She claims she uses a filter... Well, I guess it's time to change it! I tried to keep my voice as quietly as possible so the other customers wouldn't hear but she kept yelling. She's really rude and honestly, I prob will not come back.  I truly believe that the success of a restaurant is 40% food, 50% customer service and 10% for the rest of the factors.

Love everything about this place . We're going tomorrow to pick up their fresh in house pitas!! Once you try their pitas you will never want to have them any place else. The owner is so nice and remembers us every time we come back. Makes us feel so welcome. Awesome place

I don't really know what I was eating, but it was definitely delicious. Walked over here after grocery shopping at trader joes and was pleasantly surprised. Delicious authentic middle eastern food. The owner was super friendly and made the experience great. I would eat here again.

And now for something completely different. This place is a tad on the pricey side, but the quality more than makes up for it. Plus, the menu is very different from every other restaurant I've been to. Excellent all around.
This place is amazing! So glad we found it. The boba gnush and hummus were incredible.

Simply delicious and fresh food at Amena, it feels like home cooking.  I particulary love their pita bread, hummus, falafels and the cookies with walnuts inside. Their service is extra friendly.  I'm looking forward to try more dishes from their menu.  Highly recommended!
Bed middle eastern food in Vegas !!!! Little pricy for what u get , but he knows his cooking !!! Worth a visit
Traveled 20 minutes from the strip to get shocked of the quality of food . Worst service . Stay Away

Delicious food.  Vegan, vegetarian and gluten free option.  Great meat dishes as well.  Fresh, bright flavors.  Outstanding service - friendly, helpful and accommodating.  So lucky to have run into Amena on accident!

I had never been here, stopped in to buy some baklava. Customer service was WONDERFUL. A very nice gentleman let me sample a variety of food, all tasting delicious. I ended up getting several things & was very pleased with everything. Top notch customer service & great food!
Awesome vegan friendly place, got amazing food and the people couldn't have been friendlier.  Definitely try the home made lemonade!

I tried it for the first time last week , I ordered a vegetarian plate and found the hummus and babaganoush and tboulah to be great but the falafel and the grape leaves to be mediocre at best , would like to try thier grilled meat as they seem to be a family run business and very authentic Arab food , would recommend .
The food is incredible! Everyone in my group loved their dish and collectively agreed we will be going back. They also have great service and make you feel right at home!
Excellent hummus, tahini and red sauce. Will try to sneak in a second visit while here for a conference so that I can try more from the menu.

Favorite Mediterranean food in Las Vegas!   The food is amazing - my boyfriend and I get a bowl of hummus with chicken shawarma on top of it every time, which comes with fresh baked pita bread. The tahini sauce here is the best I have ever had!  The service is what really has brought us back so much. The women that work there are always so sweet to us, the first time we went she brought over water refills and more pita bread. It doesn't look like a restaurant where you get server service, so we were very pleased with our first experience.  The owner Amir is also so great! He takes his time to explain anything to you. Really hospitable.   Also, I can't get enough of their pickled veggies - dipped in hummus! Baklava is also the best I've ever had.  Awesome food - service - and location! Love this place!

This is my favorite place to pick up freshly-made and delicious pita, hummus, falafel, tabbouleh, and pastries. The mint lemonade is blended up to order and always refreshing. I have also dined in for dinner, and left impressed by the quality of the food, generous portions, and the exemplary service.

I eat hummus almost every day. The hummus at Amena Bakery & Deli is fresh and delicious. The pita bread is soft and fluffy. Fluffy pita bread? I never knew such a thing could exist.  The portions were generous, the food was flavorful, and the price was inexpensive given the quality of the food.   I would definitely go back the next time I'm in Vegas.

Wanted a good place for lunch so yelped, best lunch in las vegas and this place came up and I love greek food so decided to drive a bit from the northwest to try it.    I couldn't decide what to try, so I got the combo plate with sherwema chicken and beef, hummus, salad and falafel.    I've had falafel a few times in the past but never really knew what the hype was about......until I tried these.  Seriously perfectly flavored with a bit of crunch with every bite.    I have a little love for another little locally greek cafe in the northwest, but I must say, this place kills their falafels and pitas.  Freshly baked pitas are wonderous.  Both the chicken and beef were tender and seasoning was also perfect.   The hummus was good.  The salad was a nice crunchy mixture of chopped lettuce and veggies, but the dressing wasn't my favorite, but then again I've only really liked one greek salad dressing and that was from the little greek gem in the northwest.  Overall, it was cold, crisp and refreshing.  The service was great, the owner was there and very helpful and gave me dessert on the house, baklava.  I'm not sure if I've ever finished a whole piece of baklava because of the sweetness, but this one went all in.  Perfect balance of sweetness and crisp texture.    Felt this little hidden gem had a lot to offer and hopefully more people give it a try.    Enjoy!
Wow! So fresh! Flavor! Passion! You must eat here, and fast! Truly a Vegas gem and your taste buds will be oh, so very thankful!
It was ok. Expected the gyro to have more flavor and be WARMER. Really average food, and kind of spendy for the average quality.

Best kibbeh I have had in a long time... tender with the most flavor. I like whole or slivered pine nuts. There's were ground but who cares.  They we're delicious. The falafel was equally very well done.

Zero atmosphere,  yet friendly,  clean and a dozen or more vegetarian/vegan options. My falafel is absolutely delicious and the pita is freshly baked. ...I am taking a few home to make lunch sandwiches this week.

It is hard to find a good falafel anywhere...especially in the middle of the Mojave Desert! Lucky for us Amena exists to fulfill our deepest Middle Eastern food cravings.  I had a Falafel sandwich($6.49) which came stuffed with pickles and other assorted goodies. Ask for the hot sauce they have a squeeze bottle full of it along with tahini sauce for your sandwich. They have several tables to sit and eat here,as well as an awesome assortment of sweets. They make their own grape leaves and pita and lentil soup! Not to be missed!. Great place to grab a bite before shopping at Trader Joes!

This family owned and operated restaurant/bakery is awesome!  Super friendly staff, the food is delicious and authentic, and the restaurant is cozy and casual.  We could have stayed and hung out and ate for hours.  Try the mint lemonade and hummus!

This is the most delicious and awesome Palestinian  food in town and the service is so amazing!! Love this place and reminds me of home and the morning Turkish coffee  is breathtaking. Highly recommended if you are middle eastern and you need a taste of home !!   Great and thank you and keep the hard work.

Best shawarmas ever. Sauces are amazing, if you go at the right time they're not packed but either way, worth it. It's far from where I live but close to where I work and I get it as much as I can. They're friendly too!

This is the best place if you want to experience homemade Mediterranean food. The service is great and we had the owner come check on us to make sure we were taken care of. The hummus with meat was my favorite. Make sure to try their lamb shops, they were so juicy and flavorful! We also bought some warm whole wheat Pita bread to take home.

Went to Vegas and couldn't leave without some falafel :)  I went to Amena because it got such amazing reviews! The woman at the front was incredibly hospitable!  We came on a Sunday night and practically had the place to ourselves -YAY!  I took a first-time-falafel-taster here.  I was very proud of him because he was very open to trying a vegetarian favorite of mine.  He ate 5 out of 8 falafel balls and killed the hummus, so it was a success!  The pita was so fresh!  We both adored the mint lemonade.  It was amazing and thank you so much for the refills!
Sorry to say service and quality has declined. I ordered a sandwich and it was frozen pita and under cooked falafel. Sad to see this  decline in quality.

This is our favorite place for falafel in Vegas. We come here often for falafel pita lunch sandos.   Being veggie they always make sure they clarify vegan and I really love it. No fuss, no hassle, they always double check.  The owner is from Nazareth and Jerusalem. They carry those fun Osem snacks and they even carry the organic tahini containers that my father in law insists on me buying.   Falafel: It's not the super yellow Israeli small balls, but it's not the super green (parsley filled) cheap way either. They are perfect. Slight crisp on the outside, no grit no fluff inside. They melt in your mouth somehow. Sooo yummy and filling!   From eggplant dishes, Turkish coffee, to baklava, to fries they have all the goodies. And it's all at a great price.   Baklava is very hard to find vegan (most of the time made with honey) so it's nice if you get the craving!   We usually get veggie combo with dolma and the falafel plate and it's usually too much food :)   They even offer regular or whole wheat pita and wow it's good and I don't even like bread!

First time here after my craving for falafel wasn't faltering. I have to say, this place is AMAZING! The staff is beyond friendly and positive, the food is the BONUS! My husband and I will definitely be adding this to one of our go-to spots from now on. Thank you, Amena Bakery & Deli for your beautiful service and wonderful food!

If nothing else, this place is worth the visit for the wonderful home made Pita, Falafel and the BEST Hummus in town! They also have very fresh and authentic pastries which are all delicious. With so many cheap and "fake" middle eastern restaurants around, this one shines in it's authenticity, freshness and good quality. If you didn't grow up eating this sort of food, you have no idea how many restaurants are serving you cheap imitations of it. Amena is definitely not one of them. If you like middle eastern food, this place belongs on your frequent restaurant rotation. If you've never really experienced good middle eastern food, this is a great place to get acquainted with it. You'll be a fan for life!

A new "accidental" discovery that is now a new favorite. Started off with a sampling of their cookies. All fresh, flavorful and deemed worthy to have again. Returned and am trying the hummus, katayef, and spanokita. All very yummy.  In a town that has tons of Mediterranean restaraunts, this is now my favorite.

The search has finally ended!  Since living in Vegas for the past 18 years I have been sorely disappointed in what some places consider to be a good falafel.   I have managed to find what I thought was impossible here at Amena.  A beautiful crispy outside, wonderful soft GREEN inside (green is good.... Really good when talking falafel) and amazing flavor falafel ball.    It is very similar in flavor to the ones I grew up with in San Jose at Falafels Drive In: http://www.yelp.com/biz/falafels-drive-in-san-jose  I ordered the Falafel plate.  It came with 7 large falafel balls, salad, hummus, a small thing of pickles, 1 pita and the necessary 2 sauces: A deliciously spicy pickled pepper chunky delicious concoction.  It also came with the delicious creamy white sauce you can put it on anything.  It was a wonderful lunch.  It really was perfect, save one thing:  It needed more than 1 pita.  The 1 pita provided was enough for either the hummus OR the falafel but not both.  However it was not enough of an issue to give less than 5 stars.  The service was also wonderfully attentive and helpful.  I will be back.  Hopefully to try something different.

After picking up the last items on our office supply/snack run, the girls and I were hungry and looking for a bite to eat.  We were looking for a salad or sandwich place but when the best recommendations we got were for Olive Garden or TGI Fridays, we decided to turn to Yelp.  Turns out, Amena was in the very same mini mall.  Awesome!  From the moment we walked in, we were in love.  So many delicious options!  We almost made the mistake of each ordering the veggie combo.  Luckily, the lady behind the counter stopped us.  The veggie combo is more than enough to share so we got the grape leaves and the mahi mahi as well.  I'm pretty sure the staff at Amena thinks we're big freaks.  I don't think we stopped talking about how great everything was the entire time we were in the place.  We loved that they brought out olives and pickled veggies to start, then the warm pita bread, then the veggie combo...you get the idea.  Everything was wonderful and so fresh.  You know when you can just taste the difference between something that was pre packaged and something hand made?  It's like that.  You can tell that everything is homemade with love.  After almost cleaning our plates, we were told that the mahi mahi would be out in a few minutes.  We were stuffed already but couldn't stop eating.  I'm so glad that we didn't stop there.  The fish was buttery, hot and perfectly cooked.  And it came with more hummus and pita bread.  We polished that off too.  Not only is the food wonderful, the people who work there are so gracious and genuine.  They took excellent care of us, which was unexpected for a deli.  The prices were also very reasonable.  The three of us could have easily split the veggie combo and the grape leaves and been perfectly happy.  I'm so glad we didn't miss out on that fish, though.  We walked out stuffed and raving about our new favorite lunch spot.  I'm just kicking myself that I didn't leave any room for dessert.  Oh well, I'll just have to come back!

Go here!  I have never had a bad meal here.  Not always known what exactly I was eating, but good is good in any language.  The plates are deceiving, you might think that it is small portions, but you will be satisfied.  You need to go here.  Every time I visit vegas, I make it a point to come here.  It is a must stop place.  The food is amazing, and the service is good.  The waitress is very helpful and informative.

One of the best restaraunt's in Las Vegas.  I always feel like every dish is prepared just for me.  Everything is fresh and done the long way, the chef doesn't take short cuts and every dish has the flavor to prove it. I love the staff who go out there way to make me feel at home,  Best Middle Eastern food outside of the Middle East! The lentil soup and the falafel are the best I have ever tasted and I get all the hot sauce I want!  After a resent trip, I feel like I should amend this review. When the owners or family are not there, the food is merely ok. The soup was watered down and the food was missing its punch. No lemon juice squeezed on top, no spices.  You need more reliable employees. That care about your business. The food was so bland, it made me not want to come back

Went in there today with a friend and bought us both Mint Lemonades, I knew they were fantastic and insisted that my friend had to try one and of course YUMMY!  I wanted to try the food but it was close to dinner time so I have added it to my food bucket list instead and will be back asap!  Have been there before and they were amazing then too and they have since remodeled and had some awesome things for sale--Tahini, Honey, cookies, they also have a bakery/dessert section and a Vegan section which I dont see very often.
Great price, tasty food! Gyro & chicken. I literally came here 3 days straight to eat around the area. Big bang for your buck.   Located in Trader Joe's plaza. Grab some grub when you buy grocery.

Great humos, and flaffels and the kunafe is the best of had in the states so far. Small place the owners are super nice. A great arabic food place , they even make plates that are more than the usual sandwhichs and kabobs

I've been coming here for years and I'm surprised that I haven't written a review. The food here is incredibly delicious. All the food here is prepared fresh. The lula is one of my favorite dishes but I've tried a lot of whats on the menu and I was never disappointed. The desert that they have here is one of the best for Mediterranean desserts. Also the staff here are all friendly I guarantee you won't be disappointed

I had the combo plate and left full and very satisfied after trying a delicious baklava for desert. The Owner- Amer and his staff were very friendly and accommodating. It is an immaculately  clean place too! I look forward to going back there to eat the next time I'm in town!
I LOVE all the vegan options here. My favorite is the fava beans, hummus, falafel, and the mint lemonade. If you need a sweet treat, try the baklava! I'm never disappointed in this place.

Truly delicious. Stopped in here for lunch with my wife. I had the vegetarian plate and she had the chicken shawarma. Both plates were amazing. service was quick and friendly. Everything tastes fresh and was well seasoned (not too heavy but flavorful). The homemade lemonade with mint was perfect with the meal. This place is a must to come back to.

Came by for the chicken shwarma plate, as recommended by our famous and fearless CM, Drew. I ordered takeout after visiting the bookstore next door, and it was a relatively short wait for my order: about 10 minutes.  Pricing was a little on the high side: got the chicken shwarma plate with two pitas and sides of cucumber salad and hummus ($12) plus a beef kibbeh ($2), bringing my with-tip total to around $15 for one for take out. A bit steep, but food was quality.  Came home to enjoy, and it was still piping hot, which was a good sign. Chicken was well seasoned and moist, pita was soft and warm and didn't harden as at other places. Hummus had a good consistency and texture and was not chalky but was somewhat bland. Cucumber salad was standard. Would consider getting it again. The kibbeh was a small fried ball of beef and onion for $2- probably a decent price for it but not worth getting, IMO. Didn't have much flavor and just didn't stand out at all.  Service while in store was good- they friendly and polite. They have a deli counter with various salads, a pastry case with desserts, and a few random grocery items scattered about without prices. To the bottom right of the menu, there's a specials board: the open face eggplant sandwich is new and sounds like it might be tasty. Will be keeping this place in mind next time I need lunch after the bookstore, or want a quick-fix to my shwarma cravings.

The dishes are very delicious and the service here is excellent! If you ever plan on vacationing in Las Vegas, I highly recommend going here. Whether you have an adventurous pallet or not, you will not be disappointed.

Everything was prepared fresh and the  shawarma and gyros were tender and flavorful. The grape leaves are the best I've ever had. However, the grilled chicken was rather dry but beautifully presented. The yoghurt is the best in town!! Make sure you order the fresh lemonade with mint, perfect for summer. Overall, homemade Mediterranean, so healthy!!
By far best pita bread you will taste in this town. All of their meat plates are spectacular and the falafel is my personal favorite. Gyro meat will melt in your mouth. I highly suggest this to try.

Very cute spot. The woman behind the counter was very friendly and helped me with my difficult order. She was patient and checked on us several time to be sure we had everything we needed. Customer service was excellent without seeming like they were imposing. Loved the hummus and I can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!

I'm a falafel guy, first and foremost. This falafel, although crunchy outside was mushy and undercooked inside. Almost raw or uncooked. Maybe if they cooked it through it would be good. But I couldn't tell for sure. Place is clean, service is good and quick.

Their food is delicious with something for everyone - meat eaters, vegetarians, vegans, gluten-free...  I liked my grilled eggplant dish so much at the restaurant, that I had Amena cater a party a week later. I brought them my platters hoping they could arrange everything and look how stunning they we're!  And they were very professional, conscientious and communicative.

The mint lemonade was good enough, but add everything else in and you get some seriously good food experience. I'd say the lunch plate with a little of everything is a good start. From there, you can pick your favorites. You can also use this place as a bakery for an extra added bonus. Quite affordable for what you get.   The feel of the place is casual. It operates as a cafe for dining in. I haven't been here and not been able to get a seat.Not much to look at, but it does have some bakery goods for the enhanced smell.   While you're at it, you can visit Amber Unicorn Used books next door. It makes a great lunch stop. Books and Mediterranean food are a great combination.

The food here, for me, is "5 Stars". The service was a bit disorganized...only 3 tables of people eating when we were there, but the person serving the food got every order wrong. If you are patient though, you will get some great mideastern yumminess. The schwerma plates had enough for two meals. The standouts for us were the hummus...the creamiest I've ever had! The fresh lemonade with mint. (Drank 4 glasses!) Amena makes pita bread to die for. We also took home very large flatbreads that were like lavosh only moister. On another trip there I got some of their pastries and liked those too, though they weren't the best I've ever had (not enough filling). When I'm craving schwerma, hummus, or fresh pita in Las Vegas though, this is the place to go. (And it's not a very long taxi ride from the Strip, for you visitors.)

I have to say I been here at least a hundred times. By far the best falafels I had. They are crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The hummus is smooth and fresh. The falafel plate is just under $10 and feeds two people easy. I recommend this place to anyone. Just amazing!!!
IGreat food, portion is is just right, pita bread is soft and fresh. I had the combo and could not finish it. Next time I'll have to save room for some baklava!! Will come again.

Amazing place. We ordered facade beans and humus and falafel.  Oh my God never had it like that in my life.  Mint tea and deserts were amazing  Let's put it this way for the price it's really good meal. Vegetarian people this is your spot trust me. Don't let the location or the look deceive you. You won't regret it The young lady that served us is amazing polite and very informative. No matter what we asked her for she said no problem.  This is the customer service we didn't get in a 5 star Restaurant  I will go there again and again.

Stumbled upon this place after visiting Amber Unicorn Books next door & was immediately welcomed by the owner & a waitress. Very friendly, made suggestions based on what I like to eat, explained what was in the dishes, made conversation. The food was incredible! I am kicking myself for not coming here years ago. I love their selection. Great for all types of food preferences. Vegan options a plus! I got a sampler platter & the falafel was great, the hummus, babaghanoush, it was all fresh & just right.

Honestly one of the best middle eastern experiences around. The pita is homemade (one of a kind) the food is to die for and the owner is awesome!   He also has a place duzar in Henderson... We will be trying that next!  Must try!

Ok so this place is GREAT! The service was great! The food was great! My friend just got back from Saudi Arabia and he said that the food at Amena was very AUTHENTIC. I come to Vegas every year and I will definitely be coming back to Amena!

after months of hearing how great this place is, we finally made it here. they close a bit early and we are typically late eaters so we never managed to get here early enough to try it out. we really should've made more of an effort though because amena is the real deal.  falafel, tabbouleh, hummus and pita are some of my most favorite foods. the falafel here is one of the best i've ever had. it was a little bit darker than i would normally prefer but i believe it was more of an oil issue than the falafel itself, which had great flavor and consistency. the tabbouleh was nice and refreshing with a tartness that i find lacking in most tabbouleh these days. the hummus was so smooth and delicious with a strong tahini flavor. the freshly made pita was soft, warm and chewy.  the star of the meal for me, though, was the lentil soup. i am a lover of soup and this lentil soup was absolutely fantastic! it was smooth and flavorful with a few chunky, hearty bites of lentil. the portion was enormous and it was served piping hot which was fantastic on a cold winter night.  the restaurant itself is sparse and deli-like. you order at the counter but pay after you eat. our server was a very kind young lady who checked up on us frequently and thanked us after each visit to our table. it's rare to find a dining establishment that appreciates your business to such a degree.  we really enjoyed our meal and it was very apparent when the hubby exclaimed "why has it taken us so long to eat here?  this place is great!"

Great food, great value!  The falafel pita is super delicious and a great value!  This is a nice deli-style restaurant, perfect for grabbing a quick lunch or just having a casual dinner with friends.   They also have pita, hummous and pastries available for dine-in or take out.  We got pita, hummous and baklava to go.  Everything was great! We will definitely be going back to Amena!
.thank you gil for recommending this place it was very good especially the fresh made bread .the kabob was good as was everything else in fact I will take a order of the bread and hummus to go ..

The mint lemonade is delicious. The fresh homemade pita is out of this world fresh and great flavor. Also, the hummus, rice and other side dishes are tasty. I thought the kabobs were over cooked to my liking. The price was moderately priced..

Excellent.  I eat here about 1 time a week.  The food is always fresh, well presented, and satisfying.  They bake their own pita, which is always soft and fresh, and they even sell it by the bag, which always seems to draw customers.  I notice people come in all the time while I am eating and buy bags of pita.  I love their falafel and grape leaves.  The grape leaves are dense and tightly wrapped, and have a nice balanced flavor.  The combo plate is superb, which is a healthy amount of food for $16, and includes hummos, pita, salad, chicken, beef and falafel.  I love the great mix of flavors and the large portion.  Probably some of the best falafel and grape leaves I have ever had, and the other stuff is very good also.  I will say that I find their baklava too nut heavy, but other than that, I am hard pressed to complain.  The home make some mint lemonade too, which is super tasty, but you definitely need to enjoy mint.  Kind of like a non alcoholic mojito.

Everything is home made and extremely fresh(bread, desserts, sauces, hummus, pickles omg yummy). The owner brought us Turkish coffee and his home made dessert. Omg it will blow your mind! Best Turkish coffe and künefe Ive ever had in US and Im Turkish. If you want to experience a different cuisine along with friendly staff  who loves what they are doing this is your place
Wow, Very good, well priced.  You can't go wrong, there's delicious middle eastern food and desert.  I love the pastries.  Try a Turkish coffee.
Pretty incredible food and friendly service. I love their pitas. The limeade is strong and good. Yes!

I have been looking for another authentic Mediterranean restaurant in Las Vegas and finally... I found this place! I have been craving some authentic food since I had some of the best ones in DC!  Food: Veggie Platter- it came with falafels, hummus, baba ganoush and veggie salad stuff (forgot what they call it).. amazing! their hummus is so good with chick peas on the side. It came with fresh, warm pita and you can eat it however you want. I put the falafel and the toppings inside the pita to eat and it's sooo fresh, healthy and delicious!   Grape leaves- The grape leaves and rice came out warm and fresh! it was good.. tasted like every grape leaves rice dish.  Grilled chicken hummus platter- the grilled chicken was so juicy!!! I love how they grilled it and the flavors they put with it. It came with rice and hummus on the side.  Carrot juice- so refreshing!!!  The platter sizes are pretty reasonable. It's more than enough to get you full for the rest of the day! However, it is a bit pricey. Everything is between $10-25 per item. I have been to cheaper places, but I guess you can say you are paying for the quality. Will I be back? Of course but only when I want to splurge!

This review is strictly for the GYRO plate.  It's times like these when I question the credibility of Yelp. I came here with a craving for a gyro and with the "great" reviews my hopes were high.    The short....I ordered a $14 gyro plate and got 2 large pitas with tasteless prepackaged gyro meat.  Prepackaged due to the uncanny symmetry of every piece of meat and the fact I didn't see a vertical roaster in the kitchen.  Come one yelpers....5 stars for a Greek place that doesn't even have a gyro roaster!!!  I'm sure other items on the menu are good, but look elsewhere for a good gyro.

Can I say that I love this place?   The owners are so nice.  You can tell that they love their business and their customers.  With that said, on to the food!  They use halal meat, which is important to some. (As I've Yelped halal in Vegas and haven't got any hits, I figured it should be noted.) On my next trip, I will check out the sandwiches, but this time around I had the combo plate and kibbeh balls.  Both were outstanding.  What I really loved was the hot sauce.  So tasty!  It reminds me of the flavor from Mamoun's in NYC but not quite as spicy.  It was love at first taste.    The Turkish coffee was good but not the same as I've had in Jersey.  It didn't really have the grounds in the bottom, and I was given sugar on the side instead of it being sweetened during preparation.  I kind of found that to be strange, but I'm no expert on Turkish coffee.  The baklava and fig cookies were outstanding.  This is by far the best restaurant of this genre I've been to in Vegas.  In fact, I think I just talked myself into going back today.
We went there to try shawarma. Also, we tried humus. We liked both of them, especially shawarma was delicious. They make pita bread themselves which is worth to try.

I would like to begin with a big thank you. What I ate today at this lovely little place was amazing and it put a smile on my face. Veggie/vegan platter. There was enough for me and my lovely companion. Let's not forget the great service.

By far my favorite place for Israeli/ mediterranean food! The chicken shawarma and the falafel are amazing!!  I always end up buying goodies to take home, like their homemade humus, babaganoush and their homemade baked on the spot pita bread is to die for!! The owner is always there and is super nice. If I lived closer I would eat there much more often. Love, love this place! highly recommended.

This place is absolutely AMAZING! My coworker and I stopped by on our lunch because we were craving Mediterranean food and were pleasantly surprised. The food was DELICIOUS and the staff was extremely kind and accommodating. We both will definitely be coming back...regularly! Be sure to order the grape leaves when you visit :)

I been there few days ago the service is great the food is ok!i had a chicken shawarma plate i think the price are lil too much while i have been to better places with lower price!!!but yes i enjoyed my meal

Amena is great! The ambiance is so relaxing that I could actually enjoy my meal. My friend asked about the chocolate quickers and they gave us 2 to try for free. They were so delicious, like a mix of chocolate cake and brownie mix but so soft and decadent.
The fresh-baked pita bread (regular or whole wheat) is outstanding - the best I've ever had.  The prepared salads etc are also very good.

Best middle eastern restaurant in Vegas [period]  Friendly and attentive staff, delicious food made fresh from scratch. Feel this is highly underrated /not as popular as it deserves to be due to the location.

I was in Vegas for a apparel show and me and my brother felt like having some nice kebob and shawarma..we searched online and found this place..its about 15 min drive from the covention center..so we visited this place and had beef shawarma and the taste totally blew us away..it was so tasty and juicy that I don't think I've ever had a shwarma like this before..this place is owned by AMER I guess who is a frndly guy and help you out to select. The perfect dish..he also offer free arabic desert sometimes..so the experince was preety amazing..I visit vegas 1 time a year and I hope to visit Amena deli again next year..its also Halaal Btw good for the muslim freinds.

Maybe the best Kibbeh I've ever had!!!  Definitely the best Pita.  I was disappointed in the Gyros meat but everything else we tried (and we may have eaten 2/3 of the menu) was awesome.  Will be back.
Great spot off the Vegas main beat, great service and food was great! Had a mix plate with lamb and beef, falafel was great and so was the hummus and home made pita bread.

This place is amazing we love the food the people are so sweet the food is so fresh and it's homemade! Even the French fries taste homemade !! They have vegetarian choices and vegan as well which is amazing !! The meat is delicious as well I give this place a 10 star if I could !! That's how amazing it is !! Please try it

Delicious and healthy food.  Every time I have been here, the service has been exceptionally friendly (Amer, the owner is awesome!) and always offering free tastes of whatever I haven't tried yet.  I've eaten their vegetarian plate (hummus, falafel, salad...) and their chicken shwarma.  I leave satisfied and without guilt - it's so healthy!

Well the other reviews were right! The Hummus is outstanding!!I I had the sampler plate with chicken and beef schawarma, falafel, pita, hummus and salad and it was a lot of food. I took 1/2 home for later!! Very authentic and delicious.
Home away from home! I love hummus and happy I took an hour off the Vegas convention to visit this fridely restaurant and enjoy their amazing food and hospitality!

Pretty good! I always drive by Amena when I go for my groceries. Looked them up on Yelp and had to try it after reading their positive reviews. We were looking for something healthy that night and it filled the spot.   I loved their pickled sides and the salad was awesome. The chicken was seasoned well and their homemade pitas sold me; thick and fluffy. But what really sealed the deal was the baklava and mango drinks. The baklava was filled with a strong cinnamon flavor and light on the honey with crushed Pistachios on top; yummy! The Mango drink was light, iced and refreshing.  I wish the prices were a little lower, but it was a great visit with excelent customer service.  Thank you for the extra pitas!

The food here is amazing, the owner Amer is very friendly and eager to please, all his customers. The staff is very nice as well. It is very clean and the bathrooms are too. This is a family owned and operated business which is nice to see, and they are opening a second location in Henderson.

The best lunch I had all week was at Amena. I've been there quite a few times, and I've never been disappointed. I generally get the falafel since it's the best in town, but today I went for the kibbeah, babaganoush and hummas. When the owner saw that I was torn between the falafel and the kibbeah, he tossed in a couple of falafel for free! And i had the most wonderful fresh lemonade with crushed mint. Unbelieveably good. As always, the food was superior and the service was outstanding. Why eat corporate crap when something as wonderful as Amena exists?

So after always reading the reviews to this bakery and deli I decided to try it last Sunday. Needless to say I was not disappointed! We ordered hummus and pita as well as grape leaves for the appetizer. I'm not a huge fan of grape leaves so I expected these giant cabbage looking rolls stuffed full of filling.it was funny how when they came out it was the complete opposite of what I was thinking. they delivered to my table small little rolls of joy stuffed with an amazing rice mixture that I won't forget! The hummus was absolutely amazing and the olive oil on top was top notch finishing oil. The pita bread was hot and gooey and warm and chewy and amazing!   We waited for our main meal which did take quite a long time.if I do have a complaint about this place it was the waiting time. But it was well worth the wait. My chicken sharwma   was absolutely divine the rice was perfect and they delivered a nice pickled mixture on the side.  They even had vegan options as well as vegetarian options for my son who has allergies! All in all the foods was amazing! Can't complain and I'm definitely going back

This is my #1 Favorite Restaurant in Las Vegas.  This place has the best falafel and the best pita I have ever had.  I've been a customer here for seven years. Even though I only visit Las Vegas four times a year, they always remember me and they treat me like a prince.  I don't even have to ask for the little bowl of pickled veggies.  They know how I roll.  The falafel sandwich here puts all others to shame.  It's absolutely perfect.  I do not believe there is, or maybe even could be, a better one.  It's the Platonic ideal of a falafel sandwich.  The falafel patties are unfailingly fresh, always fried to order. Perfectly crisp and packed with flavor.  I've never counted how many are in a sandwich, but there must be four or five.  There's falafel in every bite.    The pita bread here is pillowy soft, yet strong enough to hold a bunch of falafel and toppings.  Best pita I have ever had, no doubt about it.    I love how they construct the sandwich.  The split the pita and fill it with the falafel instead of using it like a taco shell.  The sandwich comes with lots of falafel and everything else you want, cucumbers, tomato, pickles, cabbage, tahini, hot sauce, and probably more.  It's loaded. It never fails to fill me up.  I savor each and every bite.  I notice as I get towards the end of the sandwich I start taking progressively smaller bites, because I don't want the sandwich to be over.  When I finish the sandwich I as happy as Mikey C gets.  Total satisfaction, every time.  After I'm finished eating they always ask me how I liked the sandwich.  They smile when I tell them how good everything was.  They chuckle just a bit when I insist that theirs is the best falafel and the best pita  in the whole damn world, because I go on an on about it.  They know I am one of their biggest fans.  Plus, they know what I'm saying is 100% true!  They have a lot of other stuff on the menu, and it all looks great.  There's just no way I will ever get a chance to try it because I'm all about the falafel.    Mike C says: falafel today, falafel tomorrow, falafel forever!

Recently had lunch at Amena.  Very good lunch spot.  Owner and his staff were very attentive and offered good recommendations on their menu.  Food was very good - particularly enjoyed the falafel, hummus, schwarma, pita, baklava and manoshet.  Falafel, hummus and pita were particularly notable - hummus was fresh, creamy, flavorful, falafel was freshly made, crispy on the outside, smooth and well seasoned inside.  Atmosphere was simple and unassuming - very comfortable, nice little market/cafe atmosphere one commonly sees in mediterranean style restaurants.  Recommended lunch option in the center of town - again, very good food and very friendly and helpful owner and staff.  Another local business that deserves support based on quality and service.

I have to say hands down the best baklava I've tried in the U.S. Since being in the Middle East since 2010 I've been on the hunt for decent Mediterranean food and this place hits the spot.  I ordered the Chicken Shawarma and it was great! Loved the homemade hummus. The only thing was the price. Total was $16 and that was just for me but if you want great healthy food then you gotta pay for it.  The baklava was moist and not too sweet. Still flakey and delish! It was great.. Everybody has to try their baklava at least once.

Best Baklava ! I ordered the vegetarian combo, fresh healthy deliciousness in every bite. Tabouleh, baba ganoush, hummos, falafel & salad. The falafel was heaven, light as a feather and crunchy on the outside. I should have stopped half way through but it was too good. My husband got the lamb plate, it was good, nicely spiced. The portions are big and very filling... We ordered 2 katayef to take home, wished we'd saved room ! They were made to order came out piping hot and delicious but we were too full. We ordered a cheese and a walnut, such goodness, I could only think how these must taste piping hot !  I would go back just for a piping hot katayef !
Everybody hear is so nice ! Just moved here and will definitely be coming back! So yummy AND healthy
Had the combo plate... Huge amount of food and everything on it was incredible! Homemade pita bread is outta sight! Will be making this place my go to for Mediterranean!

What a find!   We rolled into town from Moab, Utah today and headed to Trader Joe's. for some groceries.  A couple of doors down, we found Amena.  We arrived around 3 pm for dinner. Amer, the owner, was extraordinarily nice. He offered us suggestions and even some free tastes. We ordered hummus, baba ganush, tabuli, and falafel plates, chips (french fries),  and a separate chicken shwarma sandwich. Everything was freshly made - I mean really just made for us. This was some of the best middle east food I've eaten in the US.  The pita was incredibly soft and moist - it was just baked earlier in the morning. The baba was smoky with some chunks of eggplant and garnished with mint. The hummus was smooth and creamy with 4 falafel added on top (we didn't know the plate came with these). The falafel was very crispy, but not over fried. The interior of it was very green, indicating Amer used lots of parsley and cilantro.   For desert, Amer suggested his homemade Kunaffe - filo, honey, sweet goat cheese topped with pistachios. Wow!  You come here obviously for the food, not the table settings. Most of the food came on ceramic plates, but a few dishes came on paper plates. Silverware was not plastic. Basically, you order at the counter, sit and the food is brought to you. That was just fine by us.  At first the prices seemed a big high, but once we had a chance to eat the food, the quality far surpassed anything that would be priced less. Here you clearly get tremendous value for what you are paying for. Especially, since all the food was freshly prepared for us - nothing was prepped waiting to be added to our dishes.   Amer is an outstanding value. If you are looking for incredible middle eastern food, this is the place to go.
Found this little gem by accident and are we happy we did!   People very friendly and the food was fabulous Definitely will come back.

I've got two words for you: Baba Ganoush. Amena knows how to do this dip WELL. SMOKEY DELICIOUS CREAMY, All the things it needs to be. Besides the baba ganoush, the tabouli and salad were excellent. The falafel is good. Their freshly baked pita bread (in-house) are like little pillows of joy, SOOOO GOOOOOD. definitely give this spot a try. The interior is a little piece of Nazareth. Amena will not disappoint. Oh, and mint lemonade! Cheers!

this place has gone down since the owners are no longer involved as much! We have been going here for over 3 years and food was used to be fresh, tasty, and service was excellent. Well we went there December 7, 2014 and not only the service we received was horrible. We ordered a plate that showed it had sunny side up eggs in it. so i asked can you be sure the eggs are in fact sunny side up and soft and she said sure. When i got the plate the eggs were scrambled and mixed in with the rest of the stuff on the plate when I complained she gave me an attitude and even at first said we have no money back policy??? but then she refunded us for that plate.  But that's not it... before they used to use fresh lemon juice for their tabouleh sauce so it tasted really good, they use something bottled now so it tastes acidic and really not good anymore, i ordered a Turkish coffee and everyone knows Turkish coffee is served very much the size of an espresso. They brought it in a beer glass and i am looking at it in disbelief thinking these people don't know what Turkish coffee is, anyone drinking that much of a strong coffee will get a heart attack! So no more business from us....  I should give them no stars really.

Honest review here! I've been here quite a few times and the food is AWESOME! It truly has never disappointed. There falafels and hummus are just so gosh darn good. Call me nit-picky, but the reason I gave them a 4 and not a 5 is this, every time i have come here i have sat down to eat. Always asking for a glass of water and I'm telling you it's never been so difficult to get a refill of water in my life. They are super nice but aren't all too attentive. They basically get your food with a smile and forget the rest. The last time i was there, i went with my sister and the roasted eggplant took a good 20+ min at least. No problem, we were having a nice time chatting and they did give us some really awesome rice dish and omg a mint lemonade that was all too good. Long story short, awesome food, eh service, nice people.
This place is amazing!  The best Mediterranean food in Las Vegas.   Falafel, chicken, mint lemonade, tabouleh all amazing.   Food is quality and fresh.
The food is amazingly fresh and tasty!!! You must try it and the owner Amir is friendly and helpful with food recommendations. They really do cook with love!!

Went to TJ's hungry and instead of picking up some of their prepared food to eat (E Coli outbreak) I decided to check this spot out. At first, the word 'Deli' had me excited for a sammie, but as I got closer I saw other signs for 'Shawarma' & 'Falafel'. Holy excitement. The place itself isn't much with just a few tables strewn about. One side has freshly made pitas lined up on a table and a case serving baked goods. The other side was the 'deli' section serving all sorts of Mediterranean delights. Beef, chicken, lamb shawarma, falafel, lentil soup, homemade hummus, etc..    I scooped up a chicken shawarma plate ($11.99) which came with sides of hummus, a small salad and two pitas. There was certainly a good amount of food for the price and I walked away full. The salad was OK, typical Israeli style with lots of cukes. The chicken was moist, sliced nicely and had that wonderful  shawarma spice to it. The only knock is that it was wayyyyy over salted. Highlight of the dish was the hummus. . Shawarma, earmuffs!.... I knocked back two fantastic pitas in that hummus. So good.  Def stop by if you dig the Mediterranean meats vibe.

Food was good.  Falafel was yummy :)  Super pleasant service-- they wanted to be sure we were happy with our food.  The fresh lemonade has LOTS of fresh mint in it... way too much for me. Baklava was good though :)

We're visiting from out of town and needed a vegan friendly place. My boyfriend and I split the manakesh cheese and lentil soup and it was AMAZING. We weren't that hungry but I could easily have eaten more, everyone in our groups' food looked good. The service was so friendly and attentive, they even gave us cucumber lemonade! Definitely coming back the next time we're in Vegas!

I'm rarely on this side of town, but if I am, there is nothing keeping me from coming here and indulging in my gluttonous ways. I've only been here a couple times and each time I am always greeted and treated so nicely. The young lady that is always running around there is so generous and thoughtful. She will go above and beyond to make your experience very satisfying.      Now for the food! I tend to get the combo plates so I can taste more of a variety. The meat combo plate has chicken, beef (can add lamb for an added expense), falafel, hummus (any kind you want to try) and a side salad. The veggie combo comes with hummus, baba ghanoush, tabbuleh ( not sure what's in it, but it's delicious) and falafel. Their meats are so perfectly seasoned, their hummus is flawless in my eyes and their falafel are so moist. I think it would be very hard for this restaurant to disappoint. I also love to order their homemade mint lemonade. The freshest I've had in a while! When I was done, the waitress brought out more and told me there was some left over that she didn't want to throw out.     Now to the desserts! Baklava is Baklava. I don't have much of an opinion on it other than it being rather good, but the kunaffe! That is where the money's at. It reminds me of a birds best pastry I once tried. It can have cheese or walnuts in it. They might be of a higher price, but very big portions. If you have my tried this place and you like middle eastern food. I recommend putting on your shoes, getting in your car now and come try this amazing and delightful little restaurant. The end.
Awesome food, great price. Try the dessert
Best Mediterranean food in town Hummus wow amazing and the bread is something else I do highly recommend

Awesome Mediterranean food, definitely worthy of a 5 stars!! I came in to find a place for a nice sit down lunch. At around 8.00$ a plate their prices are very good, and the service is on point. The quality of the food supercedes the price. I would highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a great Mediterranean food experience!!!!

I stopped in for a quick dinner and instantly fell in love with this place. Fresh bakes pita and desserts are for sale and the girl working the counter was polite and helpful. My friend and I ordered the Combo Special and Tabbouleh salad which was plenty for the both of us. Everything was DELICIOUS! The falafel was the best I have had in Vegas, the meat was amazingly seasoned, the hummus was perfect, the whole wheat pita soft and fresh, and the side sauces were perfectly complimentary. I highly recommend this place to everyone!

Mmmmmm!! Hiding in a shopping plaza with Trader Joe's, Amena is a welcoming place with delicious healthy options. Came in with my two brothers and bf and were helped immediately. We got the homemade lemonades, by the way come with mint and shaved ice and are well worth the wait! I ordered the gyro lamb sandwich, which I assumed came with the salad. Oops, I was wrong. But noticing that I was disappointed, in the fact my bf was thoroughly enjoying his salad, a man I assume was the owner, came up an explained how it wasn't part of the sandwich, but if for this time only if like to get one, on the house. Surprised, I said yes and enjoyed one the best little salads I have in awhile, I definitely would buy their salad dressing if they sold it. 10/10 would come again, and definitely get the plate lol.

I read an article about Strip chefs' favorite off-Strip restaurants and this was one of them. I can see why. It's definitely a hidden gem. Their homemade pita and hummus are amazing, and the space is really clean and bright. Try the chicken shawarma pita and definitely get a mint lemonade.
Late Lunch after Mani/Pedi: Turkish Coffee Beef Shawama Sandwich (Humus OTS) Homemade Mint Lemonade  Yes, yes and yes! Will return for sweets.

After many underwhelming food experiences in Vegas, this was like an oasis! We were grabbing a few things at Trader Joe's and I looked for coffee. Man, am I glad I did! Now, my Mama's best friend was Armenian and her husband was Lebanese. We are a lot of tabbouleh, lamb, kibbeh, growing up. So this is so comforting to me. This place is immaculate.  A lovely young lady helped me pick a few things to go. I also ordered two Turkish coffees, which were amazing. I am a cream lover all the way, but this coffee is so smooth and rich you don't even care that there isn't any cream for miles.  I ordered a small tabbouleh, stuffed grape leaves, and when I saw the bags of freshly baked pita, oh yeah. It is so soft and has the best little chew to it. Then my hubby arrives and we ordered a gyro to go, and all the way! It came loaded with veggies and was easily the best one I have ever eaten. And have I eaten a few in my time.  She gave me a few little containers of sauce. One was tahini, and was smooth and buttery. I dipped my pita in there and savoured every bite with my tabbouleh.  The other was this gorgeous dark red hot sauce. It was thick and chunky and sent the gyro over the moon.  My hubby was in hog heaven. He vowed we will never eat anywhere else in Vegas. This whole meal with two Turkish coffees was about $30. A steal for the amazingness and high quality of food you get.   One thing that touched my heart was that they had a sign that said they would provide a box to put your leftovers in for a homeless person. I always want to do that!

Wow omg, there food is amazing. This hole in the wall bakery is worth the find. Just amazing food; I had their sampler plate with 2 pieces of bread and salad. There food is on point, normally I don't care for Mediterranean food as it's not spicy enough for my liking but their chicken and beef is just the right combo of spicy and sweet. Great Tahini sauce not water and a nice consistent spread. A must eat place and it's right next to traders joe!

I pass by this place daily and decided to finally give it a try. I picked up the beef shwarwama and I don't think it was worth the nearly $10 it costs. The meat was mediocre and rather bland. Everything is pretty pricey, but I think for "Mom and Pop" places, that's expected.

I am so upset right now that I can barely write this.   Being a loyal customer since day one and recommending Amena to both family and friends I thought my business meant something to the owner. I, at the very least, thought that my loyalty would buy me honesty. I was wrong.   A couple of hours ago I went into Amena to get some tabbouleh. Rosie prepared it. When I got home and tasted it, it was FANTASTIC!!! It was so good that I decided to go back and get another batch.   The owner was there and when I told him how good that Rosie made it, he told me that everyone makes it exactly the same. I replied that it was not exactly true. I've had it many times when it had way to much lemon, to little of this or to much of that. However, Rosie's was perfect and I asked him to please let her make it for me. He agreed. I went around the corner to see it being made and to my disappointment and surprise, he was making it. I told him that I wanted to try it before I paid $12.00 for a large. Sure enough it was loaded with lemon and I told him so. He said he'd retry. Second attempt; just as bad.   He justified his lie by saying that Rosie was preparing another customer's dinner. I informed him that since I made a special trip to get more of Rosie's tabbouleh I would have been more than happy to wait for her to finish with her customers.   Let's break this down. Over arrogance and dishonesty the owner lost a loyal customer that has been patronizing and recommending Amena to many, many people since literally day one. That's the definition of stupidity. I'm also posting this on Yelp and any other review sites that I can.   I'll now give all of my business to Afandi on West Charleston. It's closer to my house anyway.

After working several days of EDC festival and several more to go we finally were able to eat a meal. We were stopping by trader joes to stock up on some snacks when we found this gem glowing in the desert wasteland. The falafel was so moist and delicious. The pita was soft and supple like a freshly fallen snow. Baba Ghanoush was smokey and perfect! Do yourself a favor and eat here. It's delightful and the people are wonderful!

Thank you fellow Yelpers for guiding us to this wonderful place.  Wife and I were greeted by Rowan (sp) and we mentioned that it's our first time here.  We just wanted to eat from their vegan menu and she told us about their vegan platter and the popular falafel sandwich.  We ordered both and as we were ordering, we hear "chop chop chop".  I just love hearing veggies being freshly prepped.  The food arrived in good time and wow...the plating was a piece of art.  The flavors from the platter were all fresh and well balanced.  Now, for the falafel sandwich AKA Best sandwich ever!  Its the real deal and we just crushed it.  The prices are very good for the quality as well.  After we finally stopped stuffing our face, Amer, the owner, introduced himself and asked us how everything was.  He was very pleasant to speak with and gave us some vegan baklava AND their famous mint lemonade on the house.  It was tough putting anymore food or drink in our bodies but we were not going to be rude and refuse.  Needless to say, they were both phenomenal.  We picked up some pita bread, falafel and hummus for later.  We were also advised on how to store the bread since it does NOT contain the preservatives/poison that most bread does these days. Thank you Rowan!  We will definitely be going back!  Thank you for making our first time there a great experience and for going above and beyond!

I came here in September. I had a pick-up order and I stayed for about a half hour talking to the owner (Amer) and a young woman behind the counter (I never got her name). They were both extremely friendly, helpful, and hilarious.  I was given some samples to nom on: * Amazing coconut covered chocolate ball - not too sweet and a great texture. Addictive. They should be called crack balls. * Baklava - one of the best I've had. * Homemade lemonade - minty and refreshing, and not too sweet. Delicious.  I took home a chicken shawarma plate, gyro plate, lentil rice, lentil soup, homemade pita, and a lemonade.  The plates came with a little side salad and hummus. The salad was fresh and had what tasted like an italian dressing on it. The hummus was good but there was something missing - it could use more cumin and/or garlic.  I was a bit underwhelmed by the shawarma plate because the seasonings didn't stand out to me and the chicken was a bit dry. The gyro plate made up for it though, since that beast was very flavorful.  The lentil soup was tasty and nicely seasoned (salty soups are the bane of my existence) but the texture was off for me - it was as if the soup was made of lentil powder and was "scratchy". My fiancé loved it, however. Go figure.  The lentil rice was delicious. I love lentils and I love rice, so when you throw them together, it can't help but be delicious.  Overall, great little hole-in-the-wall, fantastic ownership and customer service, and good food.
Hands down best pita bread I've ever had , you can just eat it by itself so delicious ! Katiaf are very good , service  is friendly ... Many vegan / vegetarian options :)

The entire vegetarian spread I had was amazing. My favorite thing was the wrapped stuffed grape leaves, tabbouleh and the lentil soup was very good. This is not too far from home, I'll be sure to try new things next time.

I wanted to love this place, I really did but something just wasn't right.  Like Carly A. said "An it's an o.k. bakery but not a five star lunch spot."  The owners were overly friendly, but the presentation and organization left much to be desired.  Upon entering there was this loud middle eastern music playing, and I couldn't hear what the waitress was saying.  I ordered the Amena salad w/ chicken.  When the salad came out there was no chicken on it, I asked the waitress and she said it doesn't come w/ chicken on it.  Why didn't she tell me that when I ordered?  I also ordered a chicken shawarma sandwich, which was o.k. but a little sloppy and too much cumin or turmeric in it.  It was a little expensive for my taste...$20 for a sandwich and salad, which took too long to make and wasn't that good.  The ingredients were fresh and the pita bread and hummus were yummy, but  dealing w/ the loud music, the wait, the misunderstanding w/ the order and the overpriced lunch did not make for an enjoyable experience.

Dang! I wanted to be the first to write a review and TWO people beat me to it! This place has great, fresh, healthy food! They day I went, they'd only been open for 4 days and they were a little discombobulated. Serving spoons were nowhere to be found, so the folks working there were trying to use tiny plastic spoons to fill big heaping containers. Their cash register was broken too.  But from my first taste of baklava, nothing else mattered but the food. The baklava is luscious. It's some of the best I've ever had. It's not gloopy and not cloyingly sweet. The taste of nuts and honey and flakey pastry all come through.  Then I tried their veggie soup. It was nothing fancy, but somehow heart-warming soul food in soup form.   The Manoshet White Cheese pita/pizza like thing (fiteer for those who know the language) was outstanding. The pitas are fresh baked every day using organic flour. I could eat the Manoshet 3x/day and it would be a long time before I'd tire of it.  The Nazarene Salad was a standout. Cabbage, carrots, sesame seeds and bell pepper in a tasty homemade dressing.   I do want to suggest they add a combo plate of salads but as friendly as these folks are, I bet they'd make one just for you even if it isn't on the menu.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was the atmosphere. I'm not so inclined to eat in and much more inclined to get take out. But the food is some of the best to be found in Vegas.

So yummy!  My husband and I were searching for a quick lunch before grocery shopping (never go to Trader Joe's on an empty stomach) and lucky for us, we found Amena right in the same shopping center!  I just moved to Vegas and have been eager to find a pita place to rival my beloved Naf Naf back in Illinois and Amena comes pretty close! The service was so friendly (we even got a complimentary piece of baklava as our dessert) and the food is delicious. We shared a plate of falafel and hummus with fava beans and it was really delicious. The falafels are perfect- crispy and crunchy on the outside, soft and delicious inside, and the hummus is sooo smooth and creamy! I You can also buy the pita to take home, like we did (6 for $2.29, and wayyy better than store-bought pita!). I can't wait to go back to try the shwarma.
